DOC.brief_title: Cohort Study Respiratory Illness Early Childhood
DOC.detailed_description: BACKGROUND : The study build previous study fund Health Effects Institute , non-profit foundation jointly support U.S. Environmental Protection Agency vehicle manufacturer . The previous study prospective cohort study nitrogen dioxide ( NO2 ) exposure respiratory symptom illnesses first 18 month life . Between January , 1988 June , 1990 , 1,315 infant enrol followed collection daily respiratory symptom data serial monitoring NO2 concentration home . The full protocol complete 823 subject total follow-up experience one-half million day accumulate . Follow-up end December , 1991 analysis relate study 's principal focus , health effect NO2 , complete fall 1992 . DESIGN NARRATIVE : The analysis direct follow : 1 ) Time spent day-care incidence severity respiratory illness ; 2 ) Breast-feeding incidence severity respiratory illness first six month life ; 3 ) Determinants wheeze wheeze illness ; 4 ) Determinants physician-diagnosis asthma ; 5 ) Exposure woodsmoke incidence severity respiratory illness ; 6 ) Household demographic , include ethnicity , incidence severity respiratory illness ; 7 ) Determinants duration respiratory illness ; 8 ) The validity retrospective parental report respiratory illness ; 9 ) Parental perception risk indoor outdoor air pollution ; 10 ) Clinical finding assessment ill child community .
